issue.title: [CF 943] Track the percent dmg of a usable dot in relation to the existing dot
issue.body:
Hello first of all and sorry for my english,it´s not my native language and i hope that you can understand what i wanna ask you.
I´m usin TMW version 6.2.6.
What i want to ask is :

Is it possible to make an icon in TMW with the condition "Show the Icon only if the dot that I can use is x% stronger than the existing dot on the target"?Whereby x is a custom variable set by the player.
As a basis I thought at factors, like 1.15 or 0.95...

The keynote behind this is to help the player, to show when you have a strong trinket proc or buff or something else, so that you know when to set/refresh your dots efficiently which is important for dot dmg based characters like feral,affl. warlock... .

And here is the problem for which I dont find a solution

For this,TMW has to track the strenght of any bleed you apply, taking into account attack/spell power, crit chance, mastery, and other multipliers.
So it has to take a snapshot of the dot/bleed you could cast (based on your current stats) and that of the dot/bleed that is already on your current target.(This means that it has to remember dot/bleed strength on the target.)
So for example, if i set the factor to 1.15 then the icon only shows up if the dot/bleed you could apply is 115% stronger than the one that´s already up.
For a factor like 0.95,the icon only appears if the new dot/bleed would be 5% weaker.

Is it possible to find a solution, probably with the LUA-code, for this?

I think that this would be a good improvement and would be a help for many players,me included.

Sincere regards,

Jack


> Posted by CurseForge user Jacksonvye | Imported from CurseForge issue #943 | Raw

comments.body:
No, this isn't natively possible, and I have no plans on ever implementing something like this because this functionality of DoTs is bring removed in Warlords of Draenor.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
